name: analysis-busybox-no-web
description: After analyzing the 'bin/busybox' file, it was found that although dangerous functions (such as strcpy and system) exist, no direct evidence related to HTTP services or CGI processing was identified. The file does not contain web service components.
notes: It is recommended to continue analyzing other files, especially those that explicitly include HTTP server or CGI functionalities.

name: preliminary-httpd-analysis
description: Due to persistent technical issues, a thorough analysis of the httpd binary could not be completed. The only confirmed information is that httpd is a 32-bit ARM architecture ELF executable, which has been stripped, and preliminary scanning found no evidence of direct calls to commonly dangerous functions.
notes: Recommendations: 1) Check the environment configuration of analysis tools 2) Try using other reverse engineering tools 3) Consider analyzing other web components such as CGI scripts 4) Check for dynamically loaded dangerous function calls
